Looking for a Halloween scare? 
 
According to the Census Bureau, over a million children have lost health care coverage since President Trump took office while the Senate Majority Leader has stood by and watched. That number should send shivers down everyone’s spine.

The right to vote is fundamental to our democracy, and we should be making it easier, not harder, for Pennsylvanians to participate in our democracy. I applaud @GovernorTomWolf for the passage of this historic bipartisan legislation. https://twitter.com/GovernorTomWolf/status/1189928692539121676 …

And I will continue to keep my promise to strengthen the ACA and Medicaid and protect pre-existing conditions. Happy Halloween to Jack and Pennsylvanians across the Commonwealth! https://twitter.com/TashaNelson39/status/1189896794249015296 …
As you navigate open enrollment, make sure you and your family are protected from getting hoodwinked into substandard “junk plans.” pic.twitter.com/4MnqrrITbs

With open enrollment beginning tomorrow, my office undertook an investigation into the PA market & released a report revealing how individuals are misled to choosing short-term health coverage, called “junk plans,” which fail to meet basic ACA protections. https://bit.ly/2JCSpFs

Senate Republicans want to gut the ACA and decimate Medicaid, but as we can see in this statement submitted by Department of Human Services Secretary Miller, Medicaid expansion has had an overwhelmingly positive impact on Pennsylvanians across the commonwealth: pic.twitter.com/66leijRLho

Once again, my Republican colleagues are not standing up to protect health insurance for people with pre-existing conditions. The GOP’s maniacal obsession with sabotaging and undermining the ACA will jeopardize the health care for millions of Americans.

Make no mistake about it: Medicaid expansion saves lives, particularly for those with pre-existing conditions. Unfortunately the Trump Administration is intent on cutting off this lifeline, already endangering the lives of over a million children. https://nyti.ms/2Nle2Li

Medicaid expansion is a lifeline for people who otherwise cannot access or afford health insurance. According to DHS Secretary Miller, since February 2015, more than 1.4 million Pennsylvanians have been covered by Medicaid expansion.

Today, the Senate Finance Committee will hold an important hearing examining Medicaid compliance and eligibility requirements, and take a look at how the Trump Administration has caused millions to lose coverage. Watch it live here:  https://www.finance.senate.gov/hearings/watch?hearingid=C18EEE08-5056-A066-602E-80C5C59DBE34 …

Today @SenateDems will force a vote to stop the Trump Admin from allowing states to promote junk insurance that doesn’t #ProtectPreExistingConditions. We cannot stand by. If Republicans were serious about protecting people with pre-existing conditions, they would stand beside us.

WARNING: The Trump Administration is doing everything it can to destroy the ACA and so are Republicans in Congress. They are allowing junk insurance plans to flourish. These plans are not required to cover pre-existing conditions. pic.twitter.com/k8P6GrDVUX

This is pretty simple:

✓ Pass the American Miners Act now
✓ Keep our promise to our coal miners
✓ Keep our promise on healthcare
✓ Keep our promise on pensions

Democrats in the House are doing their job. It’s long-past time for the Senate to do the same.

The bankruptcy filing of Murray Energy could bring the pension and health care coverage for our coal miners to the brink. Failure to act could result in devastating consequences to our coal miners and communities across Pennsylvania and across the Nation. https://on.wsj.com/36jZ5SC

Vindman: “I am a patriot, and it is my sacred duty and honor to advance and defend our country, irrespective of party or politics.”

To my GOP colleagues: Will you, too, honor to advance and defend our country? Or will you continue to shamelessly defend the indefensible?

When sworn into Congress, we take an oath to this country. As part of this oath, Republicans in both houses of Congress need to defend the honor, sacrifice & public service of patriots like Lt. Col. Vindman, Ambassador Taylor, Fiona Hill & other witnesses.
 https://bit.ly/32VwSPG

The GOP politicians who are attacking the loyalties of Vindman are the same ones who support a President who has only taken from this country: Sabotaged our health care, ripped apart families, and undermined our national security. This is not just ironic, this is tragic.

Vindman’s character has already faced brutal attacks from Fox News and the GOP. As he testifies in full uniform with two decades of military service and a Purple Heart for his sacrifice to our country in Iraq, we are reminded how empty these attacks truly are. Vindman is a hero.

Today, Lt. Col. Alexander Vindman, who oversees Ukraine policy at the White House National Security Council, will join Ambassador Taylor and the other public servants who have testified in defense of U.S. national security, moral leadership and our democratic institutions. https://twitter.com/politico/status/1188994796242780160 …

The Administration should reverse its harmful policy relating to “junk plans” to prevent individuals & families from falling victim to extreme out-of-pocket costs, or worse, being bankrupted due to their health history or a health care event. Full report:  https://bit.ly/36oXif0

Unlike plans offered through  http://HealthCare.Gov , junk plans are permitted to exclude coverage for pre-existing conditions. In part, due to the Administration’s actions to undermine health coverage, junk plans are being deceptively marketed as comprehensive health insurance.

The investigation found that when searching for health coverage online, individuals are bombarded by paid advertisements meant to mislead unsuspecting shoppers into choosing short-term health coverage, called “junk plans,” which fail to meet the basic protections of the ACA. pic.twitter.com/C50C7Poyy7

NEW: To hold the Trump Admin accountable for the sabotage of health insurance coverage & warn consumers, I'm releasing an investigative report on how people are being lured into a health insurance plan that may fail to cover pre-existing conditions. https://bit.ly/2WyoGml

Kay Hagan was a courageous public servant and a kind and generous friend. A tireless advocate for the people of North Carolina, she served her constituents with determination and good humor. https://bit.ly/348vOIw

The White House must provide a classified briefing to Congress on this raid and the Administration’s overall strategy in the region. Our military and allies deserve the support of a united front in Washington.

Further, notifying the Russians but not top congressional leadership of the raid was an unprecedented, partisan move that made clear this Administration would rather play political games than prioritize the safety of our military and our Nation. This cannot be our new norm.

This raid would not have happened without our Special Forces who were abruptly pulled out, our Kurdish allies whom we abandoned for slaughter, & an intelligence community that is frequently undervalued & denigrated by the President. We owe all of them a great debt of gratitude.

Withdrawing from Syria disrupted a meticulous operation, forcing Pentagon officials to rush through a risky plan. This failure to properly deliberate with and listen to senior DoD and national security officials shows reckless decision-making without interagency consultation.

The world is safer now that Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi is dead. However, the raid that killed him was not successful because of President Trump. It was successful in spite of President Trump. https://nyti.ms/2q2qbNq

First responders work tirelessly during times of crisis, often risking their own lives to save others. This National First Responders Day, we recognize these heroic men and women in PA and across the Nation for the dangerous and difficult work they do. Thank you for your service.

The death of Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi is a victory for the security of our Nation and world, and reflects the true heroism and valor of our special forces and intelligence community. We owe them a debt of gratitude for their bravery and service in our fight against terrorism.

As we remember those who tragically lost their lives, I am praying for the families and loved ones of Joyce Fienberg, Richard Gottfried, Rose Mallinger, Jerry Rabinowitz, Cecil Rosenthal, David Rosenthal, Bernice Simon, Sylvan Simon, Daniel Stein, Melvin Wax, and Irving Younger.

Today, we stand with Pittsburgh and Jewish communities across Pennsylvania and the United States not only to remember the victims who lost their lives at Tree of Life, but to remind ourselves that there is no place for hate in our Nation or anywhere else in the world.

As three congregations—Tree of Life, Dor Hadash and New Light—were observing Shabbat morning services at the Tree of Life synagogue in Pittsburgh, a mass shooting claimed the lives of eleven innocent Pennsylvanians and injured six more, including four law enforcement officers.
One year ago today, we witnessed the most deadly act of violence against the Jewish community in American history.

Gun violence is a public health epidemic impacting too many communities every single day in this country. Today, I sat down with Gettysburg for Gun Sense to discuss how we can address this epidemic with commonsense solutions. https://bit.ly/32XB4yF

This is what it looks like to put country over politics. We should all be inspired by these and countless other public servants who work to further U.S. national security, moral leadership and democratic institutions abroad who have yet to come forward throughout this process.

Michael McKinley has served this country as Senior Adviser to the Secretary of State and Ambassador to Brazil, Afghanistan, Colombia and Peru. He was so alarmed over the Ukraine allegations that he resigned, refusing to be used to advance domestic political objectives.

Fiona Hill, former top Russia adviser, is a foreign affairs specialist who served under three presidents. She bravely confronted Administration officials on policy rooted in self-interest and did not hesitate to call out politically motivated activities in Ukraine.

Ambassador Yovanovitch dedicated over 30 years to the U.S. Foreign Service. She has rightfully earned respect & credibility within the national security community for her anti-corruption efforts in Ukraine, and for never losing her moral ground among self-interested actors.

Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense Laura Cooper witnessed firsthand the President’s obstruction of aid to Ukraine. Despite attempts by the Administration & Pentagon to block her appearance and unprecedented interruption by GOP Members, she refused to back out of her testimony.

Ambassador Taylor holds a lifelong record of public service, from graduating West Point & serving in the 101st Airborne in Vietnam to his work as ambassador to Ukraine & other significant foreign policy roles. His actions reflect his deep understanding of his duty to our country.

At a time when our democratic process is under attack, those who refuse to stay silent in the face of corruption to testify in the impeachment inquiry should be commended for their commitment to the rule of law and our national security.

Erdogan is empowered by the President’s reckless decision to withdraw from Syria, effectively green lighting the Turkish incursion. We need to increase access to school meals for children in the Commonwealth and across the country. This disastrous proposal would do the exact opposite - take away automatic eligibility for free meals from nearly 1 million children.

In Pennsylvania, this will jeopardize vital nutrition assistance for 200,000 Pennsylvanians in more than 120,000 households. We should be improving the efficiency and effectiveness of SNAP, not eroding a program that is vital to thousands of Pennsylvania children and families.

SNAP plays a critical role in the battle against hunger for children and their families, but under the Administration’s proposed rule and per USDA’s own analysis, nearly a million children are in danger of losing their eligibility for free school lunches.
